natural solution: Recall that $(-a)^n=-a^n$ when $n$ is odd. Because 47 is odd, $(-1)^{47}=-1^{47}=-1$. Evaluating the remaining exponents, we get \begin{align} (-1)^{47} + 2^{(3^3+4^2-6^2)}&= -1 + 2^{(3^3+4^2-6^2)} \\ &=-1 + 2^{(27+16-36)} \\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: int
assumes h0 : "a = (-1) powr 47"
and h1 : "b = 2 powr ((3 powr 3) + (4 powr 2) - (6 powr 2))"
shows  "a + b = 127"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Calculate $(-1)^{47} + 2^{(3^3+4^2-6^2)}$. The final Answer is 127
 ### Proof
 Recall that $(-a)^n=-a^n$ when $n$ is odd. Because 47 is odd, $(-1)^{47}=-1^{47}=-1$. Evaluating the remaining exponents, we get \begin{align} (-1)^{47} + 2^{(3^3+4^2-6^2)}&= -1 + 2^{(3^3+4^2-6^2)} \\ &=-1 + 2^{(27+16-36)} \\
 &=-1 + 2^{(43-36)} \\ &=-1 + 2^{7} \\ &=-1+128 \\ &=\boxed{127} \end{align}
 *)
